quests.desc: Welcome to TextWorld! Here is your task for today. Your first objective is to retrieve the keycard from the table. And then, doublecheck that the box is unlocked with the keycard. Then, make sure that the box is wide open. Then, retrieve the type N keycard from the box. With the type N keycard, unlock the type N passageway within the pantry with the type N keycard. After that, ensure that the type N passageway is open. And then, make an attempt to take a trip north. Okay, and then, take a trip east. With that over with, recover the kettle from the bowl inside the kitchenette. With the kettle, rest the kettle on the board in the kitchenette. Got that? Good!
commands: take type N keycard from box
unlock type N passageway with type N keycard
take type N keycard from box
unlock type N passageway with type N keycard

infos.name: kitchenette
infos.desc:
You've just walked into a kitchenette.

 You can make out a board. The board is ordinary.[if there is something on the s_0] On the board you see [a list of things on the s_0].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_0] But oh no! there's nothing on this piece of trash. You think about smashing the board to bits, throwing the bits into a pit, etc, until you get bored.[end if] You can see a bowl. [if there is something on the s_1]You see [a list of things on the s_1] on the bowl.[end if][if there is nothing on the s_1]But the thing is empty, unfortunately.[end if]

You don't like doors? Why not try going east, that entranceway is unguarded. You need an unguarded exit? You should try going north. You don't like doors? Why not try going west, that entranceway is unblocked.

infos.name: shower
infos.desc:
You find yourself in a shower. An usual kind of place. You begin to take stock of what's here.

 Were you looking for a rack? Because look over there, it's a rack. The rack is usual.[if there is something on the s_3] On the rack you can make out [a list of things on the s_3]. I mean, just wow! Isn't TextWorld just the best?[end if][if there is nothing on the s_3] But the thing hasn't got anything on it.[end if]

 There is [if d_0 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] type N passageway leading south. You don't like doors? Why not try going east, that entranceway is unblocked. You don't like doors? Why not try going north, that entranceway is unblocked.

infos.name: dish-pit
infos.desc:
You arrive in a dish-pit. A typical kind of place.



There is an exit to the north. Don't worry, it is unguarded. You don't like doors? Why not try going south, that entranceway is unguarded. You don't like doors? Why not try going west, that entranceway is unblocked.

infos.name: basement
infos.desc:
You are in a basement. An usual kind of place. You begin looking for stuff.

 You can see a display. Classic TextWorld.[if c_1 is open and there is something in the c_1] The display contains [a list of things in the c_1]. Classic TextWorld.[end if][if c_1 is open and the c_1 contains nothing] Empty! What kind of nightmare TextWorld is this?[end if]

There is an exit to the east. Don't worry, it is unguarded. You need an unguarded exit? You should try going north. There is an exit to the south. Don't worry, it is unblocked. You don't like doors? Why not try going west, that entranceway is unguarded.

infos.name: spare room
infos.desc:
You've just walked into a spare room.

 You scan the room, seeing a coffer. Suddenly, you bump your head on the ceiling, but it's not such a bad bump that it's going to prevent you from looking at objects and even things.[if c_2 is open and there is something in the c_2] The coffer contains [a list of things in the c_2]![end if][if c_2 is open and the c_2 contains nothing] Empty! What kind of nightmare TextWorld is this?[end if]

There is an exit to the north. Don't worry, it is unblocked. You don't like doors? Why not try going west, that entranceway is unblocked.

infos.name: sauna
infos.desc:
You've entered a sauna.

 You can make out a bench. What a coincidence, weren't you just thinking about a bench? [if there is something on the s_4]On the bench you can see [a list of things on the s_4].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_4]The bench appears to be empty. Oh! Why couldn't there just be stuff on it?[end if]

You need an unguarded exit? You should try going east. There is an unblocked exit to the north. There is an unblocked exit to the west.

infos.name: salon
infos.desc:
You are in a salon. An usual one. Let's see what's in here.

 You hear a noise behind you and spin around, but you can't see anything other than a recliner. The recliner is typical.[if there is something on the s_5] On the recliner you make out [a list of things on the s_5].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_5] But the thing hasn't got anything on it.[end if]

There is an exit to the east. Don't worry, it is unguarded. There is an unguarded exit to the north. You don't like doors? Why not try going west, that entranceway is unguarded.

infos.name: attic
infos.desc:
You arrive in an attic. A typical one. You can barely contain your excitement.



There is an unguarded exit to the east. You need an unguarded exit? You should try going south. You need an unguarded exit? You should try going west.

infos.name: playroom
infos.desc:
You've entered a playroom.

 You see a couch. The couch is ordinary.[if there is something on the s_6] On the couch you see [a list of things on the s_6].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_6] But the thing hasn't got anything on it. Oh! Why couldn't there just be stuff on it?[end if]

You need an unguarded exit? You should try going east. You don't like doors? Why not try going north, that entranceway is unblocked. There is an unguarded exit to the south.

infos.name: study
infos.desc:
You're not going to believe this, but you've just entered a study.

 You can see a bureau. You shudder, but continue examining the room.[if c_3 is open and there is something in the c_3] The bureau contains [a list of things in the c_3].[end if][if c_3 is open and the c_3 contains nothing] The bureau is empty! What a waste of a day![end if]

You need an unblocked exit? You should try going east. You don't like doors? Why not try going north, that entranceway is unguarded. There is an exit to the south. Don't worry, it is unblocked. You need an unblocked exit? You should try going west.

infos.name: cookhouse
infos.desc:
Look around you. Take it all in. It's not every day someone gets to be in a cookhouse. You begin to take stock of what's in the room.

 You rest your hand against a wall, but you miss the wall and fall onto a platter. [if there is something on the s_7]You see [a list of things on the s_7] on the platter.[end if][if there is nothing on the s_7]The platter appears to be empty. Hm. Oh well[end if]

You don't like doors? Why not try going north, that entranceway is unguarded. You don't like doors? Why not try going south, that entranceway is unguarded. There is an unguarded exit to the west.

infos.name: kitchen
infos.desc:
You find yourself in a kitchen. An ordinary kind of place.

 You can see [if c_4 is locked]a locked[else if c_4 is open]an opened[otherwise]a closed[end if] standard looking refrigerator nearby.[if c_4 is open and there is something in the c_4] The refrigerator contains [a list of things in the c_4].[end if][if c_4 is open and the c_4 contains nothing] Empty! What kind of nightmare TextWorld is this?[end if] You see a chair. The chair is typical.[if there is something on the s_8] On the chair you can make out [a list of things on the s_8].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_8] But there isn't a thing on it. What's the point of an empty chair?[end if]

You need an unblocked exit? You should try going east. There is an unblocked exit to the south. There is an unguarded exit to the west.

infos.name: cookery
infos.desc:
You find yourself in a cookery. A normal kind of place. The room seems oddly familiar, as though it were only superficially different from the other rooms in the building.

 You bend down to tie your shoe. When you stand up, you notice a locker.[if c_5 is open and there is something in the c_5] The locker contains [a list of things in the c_5]. There's something strange about this thing being here, but you don't have time to worry about that now.[end if][if c_5 is open and the c_5 contains nothing] The locker is empty! This is the worst thing that could possibly happen, ever![end if] If you haven't noticed it already, there seems to be something there by the wall, it's a safe.[if c_6 is open and there is something in the c_6] The safe contains [a list of things in the c_6]. Make a note of this, you might have to put stuff on or in it later on.[end if][if c_6 is open and the c_6 contains nothing] Empty! What kind of nightmare TextWorld is this?[end if]

There is an exit to the west. Don't worry, it is unguarded.

infos.name: pantry
infos.desc:
You arrive in a pantry. A typical kind of place.

 You can make out [if c_0 is locked]a locked[else if c_0 is open]an opened[otherwise]a closed[end if] box.[if c_0 is open and there is something in the c_0] The box contains [a list of things in the c_0]. Is this what you came to TextWorld for? This... box?[end if][if c_0 is open and the c_0 contains nothing] The box is empty! This is the worst thing that could possibly happen, ever![end if] You lean against the wall, inadvertently pressing a secret button. The wall opens up to reveal a table. You shudder, but continue examining the table. The table is ordinary.[if there is something on the s_2] On the table you can make out [a list of things on the s_2].[end if][if there is nothing on the s_2] But the thing is empty.[end if] You can make out a shelf. Now why would someone leave that there? [if there is something on the s_9]On the shelf you can make out [a list of things on the s_9]. You can't wait to tell the folks at home about this![end if][if there is nothing on the s_9]However, the shelf, like an empty shelf, has nothing on it. Aw, here you were, all excited for there to be things on it![end if]

 There is [if d_0 is open]an open[otherwise]a closed[end if] type N passageway leading north. There is an unguarded exit to the east.

walkthrough: take type N keycard from box
unlock type N passageway with type N keycard

objective: I hope you're ready to go into rooms and interact with objects, because you've just entered TextWorld! Here is your task for today. First stop, retrieve the keycard from the table. Having got the keycard, check that the box inside the pantry is unlocked with the keycard. Once you have unlocked the box, ensure that the box inside the pantry is open. After that, recover the type N keycard from the box. After that, make it so that the type N passageway is unlocked. And then, ensure that the type N passageway in the pantry is open. And then, move north. And then, make an effort to move east. Then, retrieve the kettle from the bowl. If you can get your hands on the kettle, rest the kettle on the board in the kitchenette. That's it!
